Shu-fu ware

title: Bowl
text: The Yuan dynasty (1280-1368) was an era of experiment and innovation for kilns in the vicinity of Ching-te-ch'en in Kiangsu province. One of the distinct porcelain types to evolve was <I>Shu-fu<I> which takes its name from the low-relief moulded characters <I>shu<I> and <I>fu<I> meaning, "privy council" that often appear, as they do here, on the inside of the bowls and small dishes. <I>Shu-fu<I> ware is generally carefully potted with fine, hard bodies and thick, opaque white glazes with a slight blue-green tint.
description: light blue-green glaze; short foot; interior decorated with light raised design of 3 flying birds between clouds, flower at center
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
